meanings.definition: The act of establishing a feudal system.
meanings.sent1: The feudalization of the kingdom brought about a new social structure.
meanings.sent2: The feudalization of the land led to the division of power among lords.
meanings.sent3: The feudalization of the town made everyone dress like knights for fun.
meanings.sent4: The feudalization of the region turned relationships into lord-vassal bonds.
meanings.sent5: The feudalization of the village painted a picture of hierarchy and loyalty.

meanings.definition: The process of adopting feudal practices.
meanings.sent1: During the feudalization of the area, people started using feudal titles.
meanings.sent2: The feudalization of the culture involved learning the customs of feudal society.
meanings.sent3: The feudalization of the household meant everyone had to bow before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The feudalization of the community changed the way people interacted with each other.
meanings.sent5: The feudalization of the city brought about a sense of duty and honor.

meanings.definition: The transformation into a feudal society.
meanings.sent1: The feudalization of the nation marked the beginning of a new era.
meanings.sent2: The gradual feudalization of the region shaped its political landscape.
meanings.sent3: The sudden feudalization of the school turned students into lords and ladies.
meanings.sent4: The inevitable feudalization of the empire altered the power dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The complete feudalization of the kingdom created a system of hierarchy.
